head.supplied: Beresford Road ¶ Homebush ¶ March 12th /96 ¶ My dear Sir Frederick McCoy, ¶ ¶ I have just received your kind letter of the 10th and I am sending you a few lines to say that I wrote on Sunday and also...

div.p:
To proof.
get details from King letters.
Beresford Road

I have just received your kind letter of the 10th and I am sending you a few lines to say that I wrote on Sunday and also on Tuesday telling you that we would go to Melbourne on the 13th by Express — arriving there in the morning of the 14th and that my nephew [Eaca] Humphery and I would have great pleasure in taking an early dinner with you on Sunday the 15th. On Tuesday I wrote that, if convenient to you, I would like to go to your house at the University on the Saturday afternoon, the 14th as Mr Humphery advised me not to remain in Melbourne after I had seen you and the Baron about my science and I had dined with you on Sunday, but to come home and go to our mountains for a week — he thinks I need a change after all my hard work, but not City air, that was the reason he wished me to go by Steamer for the change, and he urged me to go by the mail Steamer the round trip calling at Hobart, but I could not do so. I could manage to remain in Melbourne till Wednesday if Tuesday was more convenient for me to go to your house at the University for our chat in science. I wrote to the Baron that I would go to see him at 3 o'clock on Monday afternoon, if convenient to him. I write again, in haste, lest you should not have received my other letters.
